Description: Pictalk aims to enable non-verbal people communications using AAC resources and Text-to-Speech. Pictalk builds sentences with pictograms you uploaded and pronounces them out loud. You can build virtually any sentence and speak any language !
TakeALook: Also, if you need, take a look at the

AboutText1: Hi ! We are just two caring brothers. Our little brother, Pablo, coun't talk so we started developing Pictalk for him. We both study Telecommunications and Computer Science and we love developping and sharing useful apps to help other people ! We also have other hobbies such as making
AboutText2: or taking photos during vacations, computer hardware, badminton, etc ...
AboutText3: Many thanks to La fondation INSA Lyon that rewarded generously PicTalk. Their program Coups de Pouce Passion helps INSA students fund their projects. You can also watch this
AboutText4: that helped me win the contest !

HelpText1: This button will bring you to your collections menu. It will delete the sentence you are writing.
HelpText2: This button will bring ChangePasswordSuccessyou to your account menu. The account menu let you change your email, language and password.
HelpText3: These buttons will allow you entering in supervisor mode and quit supervisor mode. Supervisor mode is required in order to modify, add or delete pictograms.
HelpText4: This button will delete your current sentence and bring you to the collections menu. Works the same as the "home" button.
HelpText5: This button will delete the last picto in your sentence. If it was a folder, then you go back to the previous screen.
HelpText6: This button will pronounce and speak at loud the sentence you are doing.
HelpText7: This button will copy your current sentence. You can now paste the sentence anywhere !
HelpText8: Sometimes you will need to press this button to fetch your latest pictograms :) Let's say you have added 10 pictograms in your computer and they don't show up in your kid"s phone : Hit this button in his phone and it will fetch all the recent pictograms and data you uploaded !
ProvidedPictos: Most of our pictograms come from the great ARASAAC organization which provides intuitive, nice and free pictograms for everyone. Their collection is huge and it is really easy to find the pictogram you're looking for. Have a look at their website and their awesome tools
ProvidedPictos1: We are also using other ACC pictograms that come from other sources sush as SCLERA, MULBERRY and TAWASOl. All those pictograms are made available thanks to
ProvidedPictos2: Finally if an ACC pictogram is not what you are looking for, then we're also using

HomeText1: Pic'Talk is about empowering individuals lacking of speech capabilities by providing a free and easy way to transform pictograms or photos in loud sentences. It uses Augmentative and Alternative Systems of Communication such as the ARASAAC pictograms to overcome the difficulties of communication for people with disabilities. Pic'Talk is designed for individuals but also for schools or groups. Pictograms can be shared to multiple groups and users with ease. How do Pic'Talk works ? It's fairly simple, it uses the Text-To-Speech voices you have in your device to pronounce the sentences you assembled. Why do we spend most of our free time building Pic'Talk ? I, Alex, started, back in 2019, to think about making an application to help my little brother, Pablo, talk. Pablo is one of the happiest individials I know and loves to communicate but, as he is a down syndrome carrier, he has difficulties with the oral language. Thanks to time and tons of coffee, I managed to build a first version of Pic'Talk and was awarded a price for it. As my other brother, Adri, saw Pablo talk for his first time, he immediately wanted to contribute to the project. Now we are a team of two developpers behind Pic'Talk and are as motivated as ever to make Speech a fundamental right.
HomeFeature1: All your images/pictograms are saved in the cloud
HomeFeature2: You can install the app from your computer or phone and tablet
HomeFeature3: Works with all platforms, as simple as that
HomeFeature4: It can virtually speak any language
HomeFeature5: Unlimited number of pictograms and collections
HomeFeature11: Access instantly more than 10 000 pictograms in one click
OpenSourceAndFreeText1: All of the code is open sourced on
OpenSourceAndFreeText2: . You can of course contribute or share ideas and upgrades. Because we really want everyone to have a chance to communicate, PicTalk is free and I will try to grant users as much storage space as they need. Unfortunately, We're just two students and can't spend too much money on servers if PicTalk user base grows. That's why, if you are using PicTalk and like it, feel free to donate please. Thank You!

Slogan: "Because talking is a right and not a service, Pictalk is free and open-sourced."
Communicate_IRL: Pictalk is great at real time applications: It can speak out loud a sentence composed by several pictograms. Because it was designed with ergonomy in mind, it is quite easy to make sentences on the fly.
Communicate_Messages: Because messaging is becoming as important as talking, Pictalk allows to you to copy the pictograms and the sentence and send them in your favourite messaging applications.
MissingImage: There is no image to upload
SharingExplanation: Pictograms shared by your friends will apprear directly in your home screen and not only your 'Shared with me' collection

Tutorial1: In your home screen you will find pictograms and collections. collections have a shadow around them, you can think of pictograms and collections as files and folders, a collection can contain several collections and pictograms inside of it. In order to add or edit pictograms and collections you need to press the lock button to get to admin mode
Tutorial2: Once in admin mode, you can press the green button to create a pictogram or the red one to create a collection. You can also edit your existing pictograms and collections. By clicking on the star button you can make favorite pictograms and collections and those will appear at the top of the list. Finally you can also press on the blue arrow button to show the rest of the actions.
Tutorial3: The creation of pictograms and collection is quite simple, all you have to do is to add an image in the first tab, then a speech and a meaning in the second. The images can be searched directly on Pictalk or can also upload your own images.
Tutorial4: Then you can modify the speech and the meaning to your liking, note that the speech is what will be said and the meaning is what will be displayed. Finally you can also assign colors to pictograms and collections which will appear as a border around the pictogram, by default the color is transparent.
Tutorial5: After creating your pictograms and collections you can perform several actions on them by getting in admin mode and then clicking on the blue arrow button. You can edit or delete pictograms. Collections can also be copied and then pasted and also shared to other users
